solution.text:
As the vertical height is not given it better not to use the formula to find the CSA of the frustum
We can extend the slant height of the construct a cone
We now have two cones bigger cone that contains the frustum and extended smaller cone
Let the slant height of smaller cone be P, so slant height of the bigger cone becomes (P+x)
CSA frustum= CSA of bigger cone - CSA of smaller cone= \(\pi \times R \times (P+x) - \pi \times r \times P\)
Now to find the value of P we can use similarity of triangles
Taking a section of the extended cone we see smaller cone is similar to the bigger cone
therefore, \(\frac P{P+x} =\frac rR\)
\(\Rightarrow R\times P=(P+x)\times r \Rightarrow P= \frac {xr}{R-r}\)
\(\Rightarrow P=_{{trunc(Decimal(j)*l/(k-j),2)}}_\)
now CSA of the frustrum =\(\pi \times [_{k}_\times (_{{trunc(Decimal(j)*l/(k-j),2)}}_+_{l}_)-_{j}_ \times (_{{trunc(Decimal(j)*l/(k-j),2)}}_)]\)
\(\Rightarrow _{{trunc(pi_val*(k*(j*l/(k-j)+l)-j*j*l/(k-j)),2)}}_\)
